p: Only 14 isolates out of 297 presumptive isolated colonies have been characterized as Bacillus species among all the examined samples. The details are as follows: Bacillus spp. have been detected in 2 out of 6 fresh chicken meat samples (33.34%), 3 out of 12 beef luncheon samples (25.0%), 5 out of 12 ground beef samplesÂ (41.67%), only 1 out of 6 basterma samples(16.67%), and 3 out of 3 beef burger samples (100.0%), while Bacillus spp. has not been detected in fresh veal meat, fresh mutton meat and chicken luncheon samples ( Table 1).
